CONVERSATION.4: Why am I not allowed to shake hands anymore?
CONVERSATION.SEC: I'm here to help you, ask me what you want about COVID-19!

BEST PRACTICES.title: Best Practices
BEST PRACTICES.CT1: Basic protective measures against the new coronavirus
BEST PRACTICES.D1: Stay aware of the latest information on the COVID-19 outbreak, available on the WHO website and through your national and local public health authority. Most people who become infected experience mild illness and recover, but it can be more severe for others. Take care of your health and protect others by doing the following
BEST PRACTICES.CT2: Why is it recommended to avoid close contact with anyone who has fever and cough?
BEST PRACTICES.D2: There are several ways you can protect yourself from the new coronavirus.  one of the recommended measures is to avoid close contact with anyone who has fever and cough. Watch this short video to learn more about it
BEST PRACTICES.CT3: How is the new coronavirus affecting people who get it?
BEST PRACTICES.D3: As with other respiratory illnesses, infections with 2019-nCoV can cause mild symptoms including runny nose, sore throat, cough and fever. It can be more severe for some persons ,and more rarely, it can be fatal. Watch this short video to find out more.
BEST PRACTICES.CT4: Basic protective measures against the new coronavirus
BEST PRACTICES.D4: As with other respiratory illnesses, infections with 2019-nCoV can cause mild symptoms including runny nose, sore throat, cough and fever. It can be more severe for some persons ,and more rarely, it can be fatal. Watch this short video to find out more.

TEST YOURSELF.title: Test Yourself
TEST YOURSELF.c1: Your condition does not seem to be of concern.
TEST YOURSELF.c2: You need to call a doctor now.
TEST YOURSELF.1: Have you come into close contact with someone who has a laboratory confirmed COVID – 19 diagnosis?
TEST YOURSELF.3: In the past few days, do you have a cough or increase in your usual cough?
TEST YOURSELF.4: Do you have a sore throat these past few days?
TEST YOURSELF.5: In the past 24 hours, have you had diarrhea?
TEST YOURSELF.6: Do you have  symptoms of lower respiratory illness such as  shortness of breath or difficulty breathing?
TEST YOURSELF.error: You need to select Yes or No

QUIZ.title: Quiz
QUIZ.p: Thank you, you can have more information in our
QUIZ.1: Do you Wash your hands frequently?
QUIZ.2: Do you often touch your eyes, nose and mouth?
QUIZ.3: Do you cover your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze?
QUIZ.4: Are you a patient of any Cardiovascular or Chronic respiratory disease, Diabetes, Hypertension or Cancer?
QUIZ.5: If you find yourself with fever, cough or difficulty in breathing, do you know exactly what to do in the current scenario?
QUIZ.2Y: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth.
QUIZ.3Y: Good, make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene.
QUIZ.4Y: Take care, you have a higher chance of complication if infected
QUIZ.5Y: Good, if you're symptomatic, seeking medical care is the first thing to do.
QUIZ.1N: You need to wash your hands more frequently
QUIZ.2N: Good, avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth.
QUIZ.4N: You have considerably lesser chance of complications
QUIZ.5N: Seek urgent medical care if you're symptomatic.
QUIZ.1M: Washing your hands frequently, regularly and thoroughly with soap and water or using alcohol-based hand rub kills viruses that may be on your hands.
QUIZ.2M: Hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth. From there, the virus can enter your body and can make you sick.
QUIZ.3M: Cover your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze, then dispose of the used tissue immediately. Droplets spread virus. By following good respiratory hygiene you can protect the people around you from viruses such as cold, flu and COVID-19.
QUIZ.4M: The risk of fatality from Coronavirus is higher if you have any such pre-existing conditions. Take extra care if you fall into this category. Seek medical attention immediately if you experience the symptoms.
QUIZ.5M: If you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care as soon as possible. Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance. Follow the directions of your local health authority.National and local authorities will have the most up to date information on the situation in your area. Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility. This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections.
